author: chfast
content: I'm not sure I fully understand what you mean by "amortize deployment-time validation" but one of the goals of [EIP-3860: Limit and meter initcode](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3860) is to charge additional cost to be able to do the validation on the initcode. I.e. to be able to run initcode and deployed code as they are already validated.

author: chfast
content: This seems to be the case except for "immutable" variables which are actually placed in the deployed code.

author: gcolvin
content: I was thinking of your notion that we should have more ephemeral code, not less.  For initcode the cost of validating it might be high but gets spread across all of the future calls of the contract code it creates.  I'm not sure what other ephemeral code you have in mind, but if runs just once the cost of validation might be too high to justify running it.
